intro: Rhaponticum carthamoides var. chamarense, commonly known as the Chamarense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, forming a cluster at the top of the stem. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is noted for its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses.
